speaker: SANDS
text_entry: SCENE IV. A Hall in York Place.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Hautboys. A small table under a state for CARDINAL  WOLSEY, a longer table for the guests. Then enter  ANNE and divers other Ladies and Gentlemen as  guests, at one door; at another door, enter GUILDFORD

speaker: GUILDFORD
text_entry: Ladies, a general welcome from his grace

speaker: GUILDFORD
text_entry: Salutes ye all; this night he dedicates

speaker: GUILDFORD
text_entry: To fair content and you: none here, he hopes,

speaker: GUILDFORD
text_entry: In all this noble bevy, has brought with her

speaker: GUILDFORD
text_entry: One care abroad; he would have all as merry

speaker: GUILDFORD
text_entry: As, first, good company, good wine, good welcome,

speaker: GUILDFORD
text_entry: Can make good people. O, my lord, you're tardy:

speaker: GUILDFORD
text_entry: Enter Chamberlain, SANDS, and LOVELL

speaker: GUILDFORD
text_entry: The very thought of this fair company

speaker: GUILDFORD
text_entry: Clapp'd wings to me.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: You are young, Sir Harry Guildford.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Sir Thomas Lovell, had the cardinal

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: But half my lay thoughts in him, some of these

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Should find a running banquet ere they rested,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: I think would better please 'em: by my life,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: They are a sweet society of fair ones.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: O, that your lordship were but now confessor

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: To one or two of these!

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: I would I were;

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: They should find easy penance.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Faith, how easy?

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: As easy as a down-bed would afford it.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Sweet ladies, will it please you sit? Sir Harry,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Place you that side; I'll take the charge of this:

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: His grace is entering. Nay, you must not freeze;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Two women placed together makes cold weather:

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: My Lord Sands, you are one will keep 'em waking;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Pray, sit between these ladies.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: By my faith,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: And thank your lordship. By your leave, sweet ladies:

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: If I chance to talk a little wild, forgive me;

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: I had it from my father.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Was he mad, sir?

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: O, very mad, exceeding mad, in love too:

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: But he would bite none; just as I do now,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: He would kiss you twenty with a breath.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Kisses her

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Well said, my lord.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: So, now you're fairly seated. Gentlemen,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: The penance lies on you, if these fair ladies

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Pass away frowning.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: For my little cure,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Let me alone.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Hautboys. Enter CARDINAL WOLSEY, and takes his state

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You're welcome, my fair guests: that noble lady,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Or gentleman, that is not freely merry,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Is not my friend: this, to confirm my welcome;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And to you all, good health.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Drinks

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Your grace is noble:

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Let me have such a bowl may hold my thanks,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: And save me so much talking.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: My Lord Sands,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I am beholding to you: cheer your neighbours.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Ladies, you are not merry: gentlemen,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Whose fault is this?

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: The red wine first must rise

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: In their fair cheeks, my lord; then we shall have 'em

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Talk us to silence.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: You are a merry gamester,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: My Lord Sands.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Yes, if I make my play.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Here's to your ladyship: and pledge it, madam,

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: For 'tis to such a thing,--

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: You cannot show me.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: I told your grace they would talk anon.

speaker: SANDS
text_entry: Drum and trumpet, chambers discharged

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: What's that?

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Look out there, some of ye.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: What warlike voice,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And to what end is this? Nay, ladies, fear not;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: By all the laws of war you're privileged.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Re-enter Servant

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: How now! what is't?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: A noble troop of strangers;

speaker: Servant
text_entry: For so they seem: they've left their barge and landed;

speaker: Servant
text_entry: And hither make, as great ambassadors

speaker: Servant
text_entry: From foreign princes.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Good lord chamberlain,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Go, give 'em welcome; you can speak the French tongue;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And, pray, receive 'em nobly, and conduct 'em

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Into our presence, where this heaven of beauty

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Shall shine at full upon them. Some attend him.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Exit Chamberlain, attended. All rise, and tables removed

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You have now a broken banquet; but we'll mend it.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A good digestion to you all: and once more

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I shower a welcome on ye; welcome all.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Hautboys. Enter KING HENRY VIII and others, as  masquers, habited like shepherds, ushered by the  Chamberlain. They pass directly before CARDINAL WOLSEY, and gracefully salute him

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A noble company! what are their pleasures?

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Because they speak no English, thus they pray'd

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: To tell your grace, that, having heard by fame

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Of this so noble and so fair assembly

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: This night to meet here, they could do no less

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Out of the great respect they bear to beauty,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: But leave their flocks; and, under your fair conduct,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Crave leave to view these ladies and entreat

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: An hour of revels with 'em.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Say, lord chamberlain,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: They have done my poor house grace; for which I pay 'em

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A thousand thanks, and pray 'em take their pleasures.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: They choose Ladies for the dance. KING HENRY VIII chooses ANNE

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The fairest hand I ever touch'd! O beauty,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Till now I never knew thee!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Music. Dance

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: My lord!

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Your grace?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Pray, tell 'em thus much from me:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: There should be one amongst 'em, by his person,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: More worthy this place than myself; to whom,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: If I but knew him, with my love and duty

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I would surrender it.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: I will, my lord.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Whispers the Masquers

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: What say they?

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Such a one, they all confess,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: There is indeed; which they would have your grace

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Find out, and he will take it.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Let me see, then.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: By all your good leaves, gentlemen; here I'll make

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: My royal choice.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Ye have found him, cardinal:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Unmasking

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You hold a fair assembly; you do well, lord:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You are a churchman, or, I'll tell you, cardinal,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I should judge now unhappily.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I am glad

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Your grace is grown so pleasant.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My lord chamberlain,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Prithee, come hither: what fair lady's that?

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: An't please your grace, Sir Thomas Bullen's daughter--

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: The Viscount Rochford,--one of her highness' women.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: By heaven, she is a dainty one. Sweetheart,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I were unmannerly, to take you out,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And not to kiss you. A health, gentlemen!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Let it go round.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Sir Thomas Lovell, is the banquet ready

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I' the privy chamber?

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Yes, my lord.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Your grace,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I fear, with dancing is a little heated.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I fear, too much.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: There's fresher air, my lord,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: In the next chamber.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Lead in your ladies, every one: sweet partner,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I must not yet forsake you: let's be merry:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Good my lord cardinal, I have half a dozen healths

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To drink to these fair ladies, and a measure

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To lead 'em once again; and then let's dream

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Who's best in favour. Let the music knock it.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exeunt with trumpets
